Nerangs.ab: abarhāwan čīyōn xwaršēd gardēd andar hāwan sē bār gardēnīdan ud hōm ud urwarām pad abarhāwan stānišn haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm ... hunuuaitiiā̊ aṣ̌aiia fraš́ūtaiiā̊ fraš́āuuaiiamnaiiā̊ pad aršuxδanąmca vacaŋhąm ēk srēšk ǰīwām abganišn srauuaŋhąmca zaraϑuštrinąm ... vaxəδβanąmca varštuuanąmca pad aϑa.zī nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən hāwandastag az hōm ud urwarām hammis az dast ī hōy be barsom barišn humaiia aēta ... īžiiāca cinaϑāmaide aϑa.zī.nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən urwarām ud hōm pad abarhāwan abāg kustag ī hōy pad sar ī barsom abāz nihišn

"He has to turn turn three times the pestle around in the mortar in the direction in which the sun rotates and to take hōm and urwarām with the abarhāwan. haomanąmca harəš́iiamnanąm ... hunuuaitiiā̊ aṣ̌aiia fraš́ūtaiiā̊ fraš́āuuaiiamnaiiā̊. At aršuxδanąmca vacaŋhąm, he has to pour a drop (of hōm and urwarām) into the ǰīwām (and continue with) srauuaŋhąmca zaraϑuštrinąm ... vaxəδβanąmca varštuuanąmca. At aϑa.zī nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən, he has to bring the hāwandastag together with the hōm and the urwarām from the left hand to the barsom (and continue with) humaiia aēta ... īžiiāca cinaϑāmaide. (At) aϑa.zī.nə̄ humāiiōtara aŋhən, he has to touch the end of the barsom on the left side with the abarhāwan that has the hōm and urwarām."
